events.title: Bitcoin whitepaper published
events.description: Satoshi Nakamoto publishes the Bitcoin whitepaper titled "Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System" on a cryptography mailing list.

events.title: Genesis block mined
events.description: The Bitcoin network is launched with the mining of the first block, known as the "genesis block", which contained a reward of 50 bitcoins.

events.title: First real-world transaction
events.description: Programmer Laszlo Hanyecz pays 10,000 bitcoins for two pizzas, marking Bitcoin's first known purchase of a tangible good.

events.title: Bitcoin trading begins
events.description: Bitcoin begins trading on exchanges, with an initial price of around $0.06.

events.title: Bitcoin reaches $1
events.description: Bitcoin's price reaches $1 for the first time.

events.title: Bitcoin surges past $1,000
events.description: Bitcoin's price surges to over $1,000, gaining significant media attention and public interest.

events.title: Mt. Gox exchange files for bankruptcy
events.description: The Mt. Gox exchange, which handled around 70% of all Bitcoin transactions, files for bankruptcy after losing approximately 850,000 bitcoins due to hacking.

events.title: Bitcoin stabilizes after bear market
events.description: Bitcoin begins to stabilize after a prolonged bear market, with gradual price increases.

events.title: Bitcoin's price reaches $900
events.description: Bitcoin's price climbs to over $900 by the end of the year.

events.title: Bitcoin reaches $20,000
events.description: Bitcoin reaches an all-time high of nearly $20,000, driven by widespread speculation and media coverage.

events.title: South Korea introduces regulations
events.description: South Korea introduces regulations requiring bitcoin traders to reveal their identities, impacting market sentiment.

events.title: Bitcoin closes at $3,709
events.description: Bitcoin closes the year at approximately $3,709, down significantly from its previous highs.

events.title: Bitcoin's price reaches $28,949
events.description: Bitcoin's price begins to recover, closing the year at $28,949, bolstered by institutional investments and the economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.

events.title: Bitcoin reaches $64,895
events.description: Bitcoin reaches a new all-time high of $64,895.

events.title: Bitcoin hits $69,000
events.description: Bitcoin hits another peak at $69,000 amid growing institutional interest and the launch of Bitcoin ETFs.

events.title: Bitcoin falls below $20,000
events.description: Bitcoin's price falls below $20,000 for the first time since 2020, reflecting broader market downturns and economic concerns.

events.title: Bitcoin recovers to $42,258
events.description: Bitcoin opens at $16,530 and rises consistently throughout the year, ending at approximately $42,258.

events.title: Bitcoin reaches $75,830
events.description: Bitcoin reaches a new all-time high of $75,830, reflecting renewed investor confidence and market dynamics.
